title: Upgrade External OO RAS
content:
This topic contains the instructions to upgrade External Operations Orchestration RAS (OO RAS).

Prerequisites

Before you upgrade External OO RAS, make sure you have:

  • Downloaded the upgrade package (upgrader-ras-<latest_version>.zip) onto your local file system.
    • Contact your administrator for the upgrade package, or
    • Download the upgrade package from the user interface of the product. For product-specific details, see the related topics given below.
  • Verified the integrity of the External OO RAS upgrade package.

Verify the integrity of the External OO RAS upgrade package

To verify the integrity of the upgrade zip and the embedded digital signature certificates:

  1. Download the latest JDK from the Oracle site.  

  2. Install it in a suitable location on your local file system and locate your jarsigner utility under: <JDK_INSTALLATION>/bin

  3. Run the following command from the command line:

    jarsigner -verify -keystore 
<oo_installation>/ras/var/security/internal.truststore
-strict -verbose -certs <zip_file>

    where <zip_file> is the following zip file:

    • upgrader-ras-<version>.zip
  4. The output of the command might have the following messages:
    • jar verified - The upgrade package file is secure.
    • jar is unsigned - The upgrade package file isn't secure.
      All JAR file entries listed in the output must have the "smk" label.

Upgrade steps for an External OO RAS

Upgrade in Windows

  1. Download and extract the upgrader-ras-<latest_version>.zip file to a temp folder in the system where you have already installed an External OO RAS. 
  2. Copy the upgrader-ras-<latest_version>\<new_oo_ras_version> folder and paste it into the <OO_RAS_installation>\upgrade\ folder.
  3. Navigate to <OO_RAS_installation>\upgrade\<new_oo_ras_version>\bin folder.
  4. Press Shift+Right-click at the folder level and select Open the command prompt here. Make sure you have administrator privileges.
  5. At the command prompt, run the following script: apply-upgrade
    The upgrade process starts and you can see both the current version and the upgrade version of OO RAS.
  6. Press y when asked to apply an upgrade. OO RAS upgrades automatically. The upgrade process ends with an "Upgrade Success" message when the upgrade is successful.

Upgrade in Linux

  1. Download and extract the upgrader-ras-<latest_version>.zip file onto the system where you have already installed an External OO RAS.
  2. Move the upgrader-ras-<latest_version>/<new_oo_ras_version> directory to the <OO_RAS_installation>/upgrade/ directory.
  3. Navigate to <OO_RAS_installation>/upgrade/<new_oo_ras_version> directory.
  4. Run the commands: 
    chmod a+x java/linux64/bin/java
    chmod a+x -R java/linux64/lib
    This grants the Java executable and lib folder execution rights.
  5. Next, run the following command: chmod 777 apply-upgrade
    This grants permission to read, write, and execute the file for the upgrade.
  6. To apply the upgrade, run the following script: ./apply-upgrade
  7. Press y when asked to apply an upgrade. OO RAS upgrades automatically. When the upgrade is successful, the process ends with an "Upgrade Success" message.

Related topics

  • For information on downloading the OO upgrade packages from the user interface of the Service Management product, see the topic On-premises Bridge download center.
  • For instructions on how to set up workers, see the Set up workers and RASes topic.
  • For instructions to install an External OO RAS, see the Install External OO RAS topic.
